required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Post-market Study of the Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload With Tri-Staple™ Technology
clinical_study.official_title: A Post-market Study of the Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload With Tri-Staple™ Technology

brief_summary.textblock: A post-market study of the Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload with Tri-Staple™ Technology.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this prospective, two-arm, multicenter, post-market study is to evaluate safety through the incidence of reported device-related adverse events (AEs) through 30 days following use of the Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload with Tri-Staple™ Technology in subjects undergoing indicated abdominal or thoracic procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: The Primary Endpoint is the Incidence of Reported Device-related Adverse Events (AEs) Through 30 Days Following Indicated Abdominal or Thoracic Procedures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Staple Line Assessment: Incidence of Staple Line Bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of staple line bleeding will be measured as ≥ 50 cc

secondary_outcome.measure: Staple Line Assessment: Incidence of Leakage
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by air leak test, or standard of care, as applicable

secondary_outcome.measure: Staple Line Assessment: Duration of Leakage, Post-Op
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, on average up to 5 days
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of leakage based on chest tube drainage in days

secondary_outcome.measure: Staple Line Assessment: Incidence of Leakage; Post-Op
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, on average up to 5 days
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of leakage for abdominal procedures; Post-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Staple Line Assessment: Incidence of Post-operative Infection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, on average up to 5 days
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of post-operative infection at the staple line in abdominal patients and thoracic patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, on average up to 5 days post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Number of additional intervention(s) to treat staple-line failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Repeat Hospital Admissions for Procedural-related Complications
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of repeat hospital admissions for procedural-related complications for up to 30 days following procedure

arm_group.description: Abdominal procedures may include, but are not limited to, laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy (LSG), laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (LRYGB), and biliopancreatic diversion, as well as hepatic and pancreatic resection. Device: Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload with Tri-Staple™ Technology

Thoracic procedures may include, but are not limited to wedge resection and lobectomy, and may include video assisted thoracic surgery (VATS) or open procedures. Device: Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload with Tri-Staple™ Technology

intervention.intervention_name: Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload with Tri-Staple™ Technology
intervention.description: Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload with Tri-Staple™ Technology (Universal Handle)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The subject must be 18-80 years of age
2. The subject must be willing and able to participate in the study procedures and to understand and sign the informed consent
3. The subject is undergoing an indicated primary abdominal or thoracic procedure where the Endo GIA™ Reinforced Reload with Tri-Staple™ Technology (Universal Handle) will be used per its Instructions For Use (IFU)
- Thoracic procedures may include, but are not limited to, wedge resection and lobectomy, and may include video assisted thoracic surgery (VATS) or open procedures.
- Abdominal procedures may include, but are not limited to, laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy (LSG), laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (LRYGB), and biliopancreatic diversion, as well as hepatic and pancreatic resection.
4. For thoracic subjects: the subject has a FEV1 ≥40%
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects undergoing cardiac and vascular procedures
2. The procedure is an emergency procedure
3. The procedure is a revision/reoperation for the same indication
4. Any female subject who is pregnant
a. Females of child-bearing potential will be required to provide either a urine pregnancy test or serum pregnancy test (except for subjects who are surgically sterile or are post-menopausal for at least two years)
5. Any subject who is considered to be part of a vulnerable population (e.g. prisoners or those without sufficient mental capacity)
6. The subject is unable or unwilling to comply with the study requirements or follow-up schedule
7. The subject has comorbidities which, in the opinion of the Investigator, will not be appropriate for the study or the subject has an estimated life expectancy of less than 6 months
8. The subject has been diagnosed with a bleeding disorder and/or is undergoing active and not reversed anticoagulant treatment
9. The subject is concurrently enrolled in an investigational drug or device research study

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
